dt: {bc}any of various {d_link|nucleic acids|nucleic acid} that are usually the molecular basis of heredity, are constructed of a {d_link|double helix|double helix} held together by hydrogen bonds between purine and pyrimidine bases {dx_def}see {dxt|base:1||6b}{/dx_def} which project inward from two chains containing alternate links of deoxyribose and phosphate, and that in {d_link|eukaryotes|eukaryote} are localized chiefly in cell nuclei {dx}compare {dxt|recombinant dna||}{/dx}

art.capt: DNA: {it}A{/it} molecular model: {it}1{/it} hydrogen, {it}2{/it} oxygen, {it}3{/it} carbon in the helical phosphate ester chains, {it}4{/it} carbon and nitrogen in the cross-linked purine and pyrimidine bases, {it}5{/it} phosphorus; {it}B{/it} double helix

shortdef: any of various nucleic acids that are usually the molecular basis of heredity, are constructed of a double helix held together by hydrogen bonds between purine and pyrimidine bases which project inward from two chains containing alternate links of deoxyribose and phosphate, and that in eukaryotes are localized chiefly in cell nuclei

dt: {bc}a technique used especially for identification (as for forensic purposes) by extracting and identifying the base-pair pattern in an individual's DNA

shortdef: a technique used especially for identification (as for forensic purposes) by extracting and identifying the base-pair pattern in an individual's DNA —called also DNA typing

dt: {bc}the enzymatically controlled addition of a {d_link|methyl|methyl} group to a nucleotide base (such as {d_link|cytosine|cytosine} in eukaryotes) in a molecule of DNA that plays a role in regulating gene expression (as by the inhibition of genetic {d_link|transcription|transcription})

dt.t: When a methyl group attaches to a specific spot on a gene—a process called {wi}DNA methylation{/wi}—it can change the gene's expression, turning it off or on, dampening it or making it louder.
A handful of drugs that affect {wi}DNA methylation{/wi} already exist, and are being used to treat cancers in which faulty gene labeling plays a role.
A process called {wi}DNA methylation{/wi} sets down "marks" on bits of DNA and is typically thought to squelch gene expression.
{wi}DNA methylation{/wi} is a mark on genomic DNA made by addition of methyl groups to cytosine bases …

shortdef: the enzymatically controlled addition of a methyl group to a nucleotide base (such as cytosine in eukaryotes) in a molecule of DNA that plays a role in regulating gene expression (as by the inhibition of genetic transcription)

dt: {bc}the process of predicting an organism's {d_link|phenotype|phenotype:1} based on analysis of a DNA sample

{bc}the process of predicting an unknown person's physical appearance and especially facial characteristics (such as eye, skin, or hair color) for forensic purposes (such as to identify criminal suspects or human remains)

dt.t: While {wi}DNA phenotyping{/wi} by Parabon NanoLabs resulted in a rough sketch of a potential suspect, no tips resulted from the composite.

shortdef: the process of predicting an organism's phenotype based on analysis of a DNA sample; especially : the process of predicting an unknown person's physical appearance and especially facial characteristics (such as eye, skin, or hair color) for forensic purposes (such as to identify criminal suspects or human remains)

dt: {bc}any of several polymerases that promote replication or repair of DNA usually using single-stranded DNA as a template

shortdef: any of several polymerases that promote replication or repair of DNA usually using single-stranded DNA as a template

dt: {bc}a virus whose genome consists of DNA

shortdef: a virus whose genome consists of DNA

dt: {bc}a test that examines DNA and that is used to identify someone or to show that people are relatives

shortdef: a test that examines DNA and that is used to identify someone or to show that people are relatives

dt: {bc}a region of DNA that usually consists of a repeating DNA sequence, does not code for protein, and has no known function

shortdef: a region of DNA that usually consists of a repeating DNA sequence, does not code for protein, and has no known function

dt: {bc}an extranuclear double-stranded DNA found exclusively in mitochondria that in most eukaryotes is a circular molecule and is maternally inherited

shortdef: an extranuclear double-stranded DNA found exclusively in mitochondria that in most eukaryotes is a circular molecule and is maternally inherited —abbreviation mtDNA

dt: {bc}genetically engineered DNA usually incorporating DNA from more than one species of organism

shortdef: genetically engineered DNA usually incorporating DNA from more than one species of organism
